title: CURLMOPT_SOCKETFUNCTION called with strange socket=0
body:
### I did this

I'm using a curl multi to to some http request, but I noticed the socket function is being called with weird socket fd=0 while fd 0 is not even managed by curl.

I enabled trace with debug example and here's the log

```
== Info: [0-x] [MULTI] [INIT] added, transfers=1
== Info: [0-x] [MULTI] [INIT] -> [SETUP]
== Info: [0-x] [MULTI] [SETUP] -> [CONNECT]
== Info: [0-x] [READ] client_reset, clear readers
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [CONNECT] -> [RESOLVING]
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev assess pollset[fd=39 IN], timeouts=2
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev new entry fd=39
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev entry fd=39, added transfer #0, total=1/0 (xfer/conn)
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev update fd=39, action '' -> 'IN' (1/0 r/w)
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev update call(fd=39, ev=IN)
I2025-03-23 00:27:48.038645 fetch.cpp:58] 39 1
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] Curl_multi_will_close fd=39
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev socket done, call(fd=39, ev=REMOVE)
I2025-03-23 00:27:48.079356 fetch.cpp:58] 39 4
== Info: [0-0] Host www.google.cn:443 was resolved.
== Info: [0-0] IPv6: 2607:f8b0:4005:80f::2003
== Info: [0-0] IPv4: 142.250.191.67
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev assess pollset[fd=0 IN], timeouts=1
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev new entry fd=0
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev entry fd=0, added transfer #0, total=1/0 (xfer/conn)
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev update fd=0, action '' -> 'IN' (1/0 r/w)
== Info: [0-0] [MULTI] [RESOLVING] ev update call(fd=0, ev=IN)
```

I exam the /proc and fd 0 has always been /dev/null.

### I expected the following

this socket=0 shouldn't happen, downgrade to 8.12.1 fixed it.

### curl/libcurl version

8.13.0~rc2 on debian
